title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 503.1 - Proceedings without hearings
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 503.1 - Proceedings without hearings

State Regulations
(a) In all proceedings
where no hearing has been directed, a decision in the proceeding may be made on
the basis of the submitted documents, protests, affirmations, sworn statements, and matters of which official notice may be taken, including records of the
department. The presiding officer will advise the parties as to the dates when
such statements are to be submitted and the form and content of such
statements. (b) No papers will be
accepted or considered for any purpose, if submitted after the dates directed, unless an extension of time is granted by the presiding officer for good cause
shown. (c) The presiding officer, upon such officer's own motion, or upon request of a party and for good cause
shown, may permit or require additional submissions. Failure to file requested
documentation may be grounds for denying the application or dismissing the
protest. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17

503.1

New

York State Register March 5, 2025/Volume XLVII, Issue 09, eff. 3/5/2025

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
